page.title: 18FLORA-THE FINEST PRIMROSES
page.content: There is an abundance of spring flowers in this area-in woods, shaws and on banks along roadsides. There are blue bells,primroses, wood anemones, ramsons, wood sorrel and in the damp places, golden saxifrage. The hedges are a mixture of many species interwined with hop, bryony, blackberry and honeysuckle. Under the hedges the finest primroses grow in profusion and on the verges cuckoo flowers and celandines thrive. In May the lanes are lined with cow parsely followed by hogweed in July - in August fleabane and hemp agrimony. Not much natural pasture remains as most fields have been ploughed at some time but there is one small hayfield in June that has ragged robin, moon daisies, yellow rattle, buttercups,sorrel and grasses - a precious site.
